page.title: 04Industry
page.content: Todmorden's industrial heritage is based on the fortunes of the cotton industry.At the height of its prosperity there were 34 cotton mills, but today only four remain in business.As a result the population has fallen from 24,500 to 14,500. Many former mills have changed their use or have been demolished.A large variety of firms have moved into some mills,e.g.electrical contracters, tent makers, plastic manufactures.None of these footloose industries employ many people.The largest employer in Todmorden is Warman International, who make industrial pumps and employ about 350 people. Slide 'C' shows Robin Wood Mill, which was once Todmordens largest employer.It now stands derelict, and largely disused, as a monument to 'King Cotton'.
